input: question: How could a citizen avoid their labor duty to their local temple? [SEP] sentence: Citizens had a labor duty to the temple, though they could avoid it by a payment of silver.

question: On what date was the publication of the Plan for Plymouth? [SEP] sentence: On 27 April 1944 Sir Patrick Abercrombie's Plan for Plymouth to rebuild the bomb-damaged city was published; it called for demolition of the few remaining pre-War buildings in the city centre to make way for their replacement with wide, parallel, modern boulevards aligned east–west linked by a north–south avenue (Armada Way) linking the railway station with the vista of Plymouth Hoe.

question: What is the largest nationwide broadcaster in San Diego? [SEP] sentence: Star 94.1, FM 94/9, FM News and Talk 95.7, Q96 96.1, KyXy 96.5, Free Radio San Diego (AKA Pirate Radio San Diego) 96.9FM FRSD, KSON 97.3/92.1, KXSN 98.1, Jack-FM 100.7, 101.5 KGB-FM, KLVJ 102.1, Rock 105.3, and another Pirate Radio station at 106.9FM, as well as a number of local Spanish-language radio stations.
question: What was HP's growth during the third quarter of 2006? [SEP] sentence: Both Gartner and IDC estimated that in the third quarter of 2006, HP shipped more units worldwide than Dell did.

question: What kind of network does SURE provide it's service from? [SEP] sentence: SURE provide the telecommunications service in the territory through a digital copper-based telephone network including ADSL-broadband service.

question: What is it called when a law disallows copyright owners from denying a license for certain uses? [SEP] sentence: Another example is the practice of compulsory licensing, which is where the law forbids copyright owners from denying a license for certain uses of certain kinds of works, such as compilations and live performances of music.

question: How did Hegel believe historical reality to be knowable to a philosopher? [SEP] sentence: Hegel called his philosophy "absolute" idealism in contrast to the "subjective idealism" of Berkeley and the "transcendental idealism" of Kant and Fichte, which were not based on a critique of the finite and a dialectical philosophy of history as Hegel's idealism was.

question: What did OMB hope to provide with their revision on race and ethnicity in 1997? [SEP] sentence: Among the changes, OMB issued the instruction to "mark one or more races" after noting evidence of increasing numbers of interracial children and wanting to capture the diversity in a measurable way and having received requests by people who wanted to be able to acknowledge their or their children's full ancestry rather than identifying with only one group.
question: Grammar schools that did not close were converted to what? [SEP] sentence: Many grammar schools were either closed or changed to comprehensive status.

question: What did Kanye state that Yeezus was? [SEP] sentence: It also continues West's practice of eclectic samples: he employs a sample of Nina Simone's "Strange Fruit," an obscure Hindi sample on "I Am a God", and a sample of 1970s Hungarian rock group Omega on "New Slaves".
question: What else are these genes closely related to? [SEP] sentence: Many of these genes are related to the immune system or modulating inflammation.

question: The transition zone between east and west is called what? [SEP] sentence: In the far eastern part of the state the Chihuahuan Desert dominates due to low precipitation and extremely high temperatures; some areas of the eastern part of the state are so dry no vegetation is found like the Sand Dunes of Samalayuca.

question: Who were some Armenian pop artists? [SEP] sentence: Richard Hagopian is perhaps the most famous artist of the traditional "kef" style and the Vosbikian Band was notable in the 1940s and 1950s for developing their own style of "kef music" heavily influenced by the popular American Big Band Jazz of the time.

question: What island besides St. Barts was granted COM status by France in 2007? [SEP] sentence: On 7 February 2007, the French Parliament passed a bill granting COM status to both St. Barthélemy and (separately) to the neighbouring Saint Martin.

question: What non-linguistic developments influence the status of a language? [SEP] sentence: Romansh came to be a written language, and therefore it is recognized as a language, even though it is very close to the Lombardic alpine dialects.

question: Who was murdered on 6 August, 1936? [SEP] sentence: In the summer of 1937, the squad was on tour in Mexico and the United States, where it was received as an ambassador of the Second Spanish Republic.
